Job Title: Remote - Senior Software Engineer, Front End
Job Description:
Who is SimSpace:
SimSpace launched in 2015 with a singular purpose – addressing the most urgent and sophisticated cybersecurity challenges to reduce risk for our most vulnerable and valuable infrastructure. The organizations around the world that we depend on every day to keep our loved ones safe and secure. Our healthcare facilities, schools, financial institutions, transit centers, grocery stores, and workplaces just to name a few. To deliver global resiliency, we provide an elite cyber range platform to curate unassailable cyber defenses, data driven decisions, cutting edge training labs, live attack scenarios, and extensive individual and dynamic team readiness training.
SimSpace works as OneTeam to elevate humanity around the world. We are committed to continuously improving and delivering a cultivated member experience whether that is accomplished through focusing on supporting our client's teams or our own mission driven SimSpacers.
We are hybrid, remote, and in-person company headquartered in Boston's Fort Point in the U.S. We also have offices in the UK, Germany, Australia, Czech Republic, Japan, Singapore, and UAE. If you are interested in elevating the technology and creative solutions necessary to secure and safeguard our future while working alongside others who share your passion for purpose and development, we want to meet you!
Why should you choose a career at SimSpace?
We are an organization that is focused on building our culture and mindfully enhancing our atmosphere everyday which is why we have collaborated on an integral value system. Our governing philosophy of being Human Centered is deeply embedded within our value system. We apply this philosophy to every one of our internal team members, external clients, and their customers.
Our core values:
Serve to Protect – We provide safe space, deliver on the mission, and elevate humanity
Acquire Understanding – We seek and provide clarity 10x, cultivate comprehension, and believe information goes both all ways
Operate as Innovators – We stay curious, practice consistency over intensity, and continue to be the change we need in the world
Teamwork Without Borders – We are never alone, we solve for all, and keep people at the heart of everything we do
What will you be doing as a Senior Software Engineer, Front End at SimSpace?
Building the frontend for a cloud-based platform utilized for building & simulating cybersecurity ranges
Collaborating with other Engineers, User Experience Designers, and Product Managers
Helping the team improve in culture & coding best practices
Supporting & mentoring other engineers
Our Full Tech Stack:
React.js, Node.js (Nest), Cypress, Typescript, Kotlin, Postgres, GCP, Haskell
Who you are:
You feel comfortable leading, driving, and delegating work that spans your teams scope
You enjoy solving complex problems & building solutions through collaborative methods
You're always open for feedback, and are willing to give feedback to your colleagues
You understand that nothing is perfect and there is always room for improvement
You are driven off of goals and team outcomes
You're focused on the iterative delivery of high-quality well tested code
You're conscious of scalability, re-usability, but also pragmatic when it comes to trade-offs
What are the qualifications to apply? To be successful as a Senior Software Engineer, Front End, you need to:
U.S. Citizenship
Proficient with Typescript
Proficient in React.js and implementation of performant SPA solutions
Experience with Production Node.js Services
Familiarity with API Design
Familiarity with Back-end technologies
Experience with CDN + Edge Networking configuration
Experience working with remote teams
Low ego engineer with the ability to quickly pick up new technologies
Preferred, but not required:
6+ years of hands-on software development experience
Familiarity with Cybersecurity or Networking
Familiarity with Functional programming
Familiarity with Kubernetes
A bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent experience
We provide the following:
Salary Range $150,000-$200,000
Benefits that start on first day of hire (medical, dental, company-paid vision, savings and spending accounts, Employee Assistance Program, company-paid Life and AD&D Insurance)
401k match with immediate vesting
Flex time off
Equity options at hire and potential for additional based on performance
Generous employee referral bonus program
Peloton Interactive Wellness Program
Semi-flexible hours, with the expectation that you overlap the main part of the day to meet deadlines, collaborate with colleagues and attend key meetings.
SimSpace is an Equal Opportunity Employer:
In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.
SimSpace does not and shall not discriminate based on race, color, religion (creed), gender, gender expression and identity, age, national origin (ancestry), disability, marital status, sexual orientation, or military/veteran status, in any of its activities or operations. We are committed to providing an inclusive and welcoming environment for all members of our staff, clients, volunteers, subcontractors, vendors, and clients.
Research shows that women and people from underrepresented groups only apply to jobs if they meet all of the qualifications. However, no one ever meets 100% of the qualifications. SimSpace encourages you to break that statistic and to apply. We look forward to your application!

About Us:
Windmill Strategy understands the unique marketing challenges faced by B2B companies. For over a decade, we’ve helped B2B marketers in technical, industrial and manufacturing industries accelerate growth through highly effective websites and powerful digital marketing.
About the Opportunity:
Windmill Strategy is seeking an experienced website developer to join our team. The ideal candidate will be proficient in WordPress, our primary development CMS, with a broad understanding of web development in general, as well as other CMS platforms.
You will be responsible for building custom WordPress themes, creating custom post types with filterable taxonomies, using native and custom Gutenberg blocks, gated content interactions, integrating plugins, best practice website optimization and more.
This is not a design position, but you should have a sensitivity to design details, aesthetics, and UX/strategy.
While you will be working within a development team, you should be able to fully develop and launch a WordPress site independently. Aside from the development team, you will also work closely with in-house design, strategy, SEO, and project management team members.
This is a remote/WFH position, on a fully virtual team. The salary range for this position is $65,000-$95,000 depending on experience.
About You:
You are endlessly inquisitive and a natural-born problem solver. You don’t want a job, you want to be part of a team where your contributions help people succeed and achieve.
Web developers on our team are multidisciplinary and bring a range of talent to the table, from a knack for technical detail to a broad understanding of marketing principles, user experience and design.
You’re a lifelong learner and you understand how business works in a way that allows you to translate a client’s business, marketing, and sales goals into concrete, executable recommendations. You love learning about how complex products are made, sold, and work in our clients’ supply chains.
You’re confident in presenting and explaining your work and flexible to client and team collaboration, always shepherding the client toward the best solution to meet their goals and needs; you know when to give the client what they actually need, vs. what they asked for.
Development Responsibilities:
Collaborate with clients as the technical lead on their account to troubleshoot issues, provide solutions, and support client requests and goals.
Create clean, responsive, highly customized open source CMS-driven websites (Primarily WordPress) with PHP, HTML, SASS/CSS, and JS/JQUERY based on project specifications, wireframes, and design files (Sketch).
Full stack development; backend and practical front-end development including complex features and functionality outside of plugins. You may collaborate with other developers day to day, but should be able to build and release a website in its entirety.
Information architecture – strategizing how we can build the things clients are asking us to build in an efficient, effective, and maintainable manner, within the scope of a reasonable budget, documenting the plan in a software requirements doc and/or strategy brief and wireframes.
Work from and contribute to flexible boilerplate themes.
Create CPTs with taxonomies, filtering and relationships.
Develop custom and utilize core Gutenberg blocks (React or ACF)
Build integrations with CRMs including HubSpot, Salesforce, Pardot, etc.
Implement and/or extend plugins, modules, libraries, and APIs to customize display and functionality.
Test websites for cross-browser and cross-platform compatibility.
Launch websites including DNS updating, site migrations, etc
Experience with Google’s suite of tools, Tag Manager, Search Console, Page Speed Insights, Maps APIs, etc.
Collaborate with SEO and make on-site changes, connect with third party tools.
We’re a small team of expert practitioners who are multidisciplinary and often wear many hats. Other related responsibilities may be assigned as needed to help the company operate efficiently potentially including:
Train clients in using their CMS installations (typically WordPress) and create client-facing website documentation.
Style and migrate proof of concept content into the CMS using WordPress native and custom block configurations.
Make edits and updates to existing client websites.
Specific skills:
Strong web development portfolio demonstrating a working knowledge of clean and efficient coding practices, user experience, and attention to design detail.
Work independently or as part of a collaborative development team.
Quickly devise smart solutions to complex problems.
Interest in learning and evaluating innovative tools.
Strong written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to communicate clearly, compassionately, and efficiently with other team members, outside programmers, vendors, or clients.
Strong organizational time-management skills, including the ability to contribute to several concurrent projects and deadlines, taking responsibility for your portion of the project as it contributes to the whole.
Extensive knowledge of HTML/PHP/CSS, accessibility guidelines, and SEO practices.
Familiarity with CSS-preprocessors (SASS).
At minimum: ability to implement/extend PHP and JavaScript (vanilla, jQuery). Strong PHP and JavaScript skills preferred.
Awareness of complementary disciplines including marketing/business strategy, human interaction, SEO principles, accessibility, content strategy, and user experience.
Personally accountable, responsible, and dedicated to creating value and success for Windmill and our clients.
Proven ability to efficiently and effectively devise creative solutions to complex problems.
Ability to work quickly when needed, be flexible to changes, and able to strike a strong balance between perfectionism and value for the client.
Strong ability to collaborate and assert a point of view positively.
Strong attention to detail.
Ability to quickly learn and effectively work in a variety of subject matter.
An optimistic, can-do attitude; effective listening skills; assertiveness and objectivity.
You have an ongoing interest in learning and self-improvement. You’re an avid adopter of new technologies, and pay attention to trends.
Work in a Mac environment using a code editor of your choice along with Git, Sketch, Moqups, Invision, Adobe.
Continuously discover, filter, absorb, and share smart solutions with the team.
Agency experience or client-side experience in one of our target industries preferred.

The driving force behind our success has always been the people of AspenTech. What drives us, is our aspiration, our desire and ambition to keep pushing the envelope, overcoming any hurdle, challenging the status quo to continually find a better way. You will experience these qualities of passion, pride and aspiration in many ways — from a rich set of career development programs to support of community service projects to social events that foster fun and relationship building across our global community.
The Role
We are looking for multiple positions, ranging from junior to senior, to join our international DataWorks development team. As a member of the DataWorks development team, you’ll have the opportunity to work on exciting industrial edge connectivity and industrial edge computing projects, surfacing data from the plant floor all the way into the cloud. Highly performant data services used to move and manage massive amounts of data, aggregating the data into our DataWorks DataHub, as well as immersive data visualization and analysis capabilities are the focus of the team. This also involves working on our cloud optimized versions of our software leveraging various autoscaling infrastructures.

From brainstorming with our Product Owners, technical architecture sessions with our experts, development work using our Gitlab CI/CD pipeline, to experimenting with cutting edge big data technologies, you’ll bring our customers features from idea to reality. You’ll join a team of very skilled, talented and passionate people, always bringing the industry best practices to our workflow. This is a great opportunity to join the booming market of the Internet of Things “IoT” and be part of a fast-growing company that is on the leading edge of the industry.
Your Impact
• Write web applications (in Javascript, HTML5, CSS) within various front end development frameworks. (GWT, React, Vue, Typescript, etc) • Accountable for delivering assigned development tasks and take ownership in-order-to deliver on time. • Translate provided designs and style guides into functional user interfaces, ensuring cross browser compatibility and performance. • Scope and estimate the development and testing effort for user stories. • Perform automated testing (Unit, Integration and End to End) within an iterative agile environment. • Share knowledge with the team by participating in Code Reviews and Pair Programming. • Participate in all agile ceremonies. (standups, planning, training, backlog refinement, reviews, retrospectives)
What You'll Need
• A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, related Software Engineering discipline or equivalent experience. • Any range of experience as we have multiple positions in this area to fill. • Open minded team players, able to think within and out of the box. • You being familiar with Front-End development using frameworks like Angular, VueJS, GWT or React with JavaScript, HTML5, CSS, etc. • You being interested in the engineering aspect of the web development behind the pixels, ideally having knowledge of Object Oriented Programming. • You being efficient in defining and using data structures. • Experience in REST Service interaction. • Ability to take ownership of task and projects. • You speaking English fluently.
